etymology.description: 幺(幺) (yāo, "small threads") + 亠(亠) (tóu, "top mark") = two interwoven threads with a mark on top -> represents a rope -> mysterious
etymology.interpretation: The character depicts twisted threads with a top mark, emphasizing complexity and enigma, hence the meaning "mysterious."

examples.chinese: 夜色笼罩着古城(夜色籠罩著古城)，散发着肙的魅力(散發著玄的魅力)。
examples.pinyin: Yè sè lǒng zhào zhe gǔ chéng, sàn fā zhe xuán de mèi lì.
examples.english: The night envelops the ancient city, exuding a mysterious charm.

examples.chinese: 他讲述的传说充满了肙意(他講述的傳說充滿了玄意)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiǎng shù de chuán shuō chōng mǎn le xuán yì.
examples.english: The legends he recounted were full of mystery.
